reviewText:
Basically this is a good program about the pressures and time-lines involved in pouring concrete high above street level in downtown New York City. The entire crew - drivers, pumpers, spreaders, have 90 minutes from the time the concrete is loaded into the truck. Pump breakdowns, crane unavailability, etc. don't stop the clock. Jobs are on the line, as well as millions of dollars - if the pour is mismanaged (incorrect concrete quality, cold joints) it will have to be ripped out and redone.

The bad news about this program is that it is incredibly repetitive -
